definitions.definition: Fast growing function based on Kruskal's tree theorem.

A perennial woody plant, not exactly defined, but differentiated from a shrub by its larger size (typically over a few meters in height) or growth habit, usually having a single (or few) main axis or trunk unbranched for some distance above the ground and a head of branches and foliage.
definitions.example: Birds have a nest in a tree in the garden.

definitions.definition: Any plant that is reminiscent of the above but not classified as a tree (in any botanical sense).
An object made from a tree trunk and having multiple hooks or storage platforms.
definitions.example: He had the choice of buying a scratching post or a cat tree.

definitions.definition: A device used to hold or stretch a shoe open.
definitions.example: He put a shoe tree in each of his shoes.

definitions.definition: The structural frame of a saddle.
A connected graph with no cycles or, if the graph is finite, equivalently a connected graph with n vertices and n−1 edges.
A recursive data structure in which each node has zero or more nodes as children.
A display or listing of entries or elements such that there are primary and secondary entries shown, usually linked by drawn lines or by indenting to the right.
definitions.example: We’ll show it as a tree list.

definitions.definition: Any structure or construct having branches representing divergence or possible choices.
The structure or wooden frame used in the construction of a saddle used in horse riding.
(in the plural) Marijuana.
A cross or gallows.
Wood; timber.
A mass of crystals, aggregated in arborescent forms, obtained by precipitation of a metal from solution.
The fifth Lenormand card.
To chase (an animal or person) up a tree.
To place in a tree.
definitions.example: Black bears can tree their cubs for protection, but grizzly bears cannot.

definitions.definition: To place upon a tree; to fit with a tree; to stretch upon a tree.
To take refuge in a tree.
